授業目的: The purpose of this course is for students to explore the concept and products of beauty in Japan from ancient times to the present-day. Students will examine traditional and modern aesthetics in order to understand what defines "beauty" in Japanese culture and in various historical periods, demographics, etc. Employing aesthetic theories and philosophies, students will learn about and critically analyse Japanese art, literature, fashion, theatre, religious rituals etc. Students will obtain a rounded knowledge of the subject, equipping them with knowledge that will be useful in art, museum, design, and media careers, as well as those that concern analyses and promotion of Japanese culture.
到達目標: Students will learn:The historical development of Japanese aestheticsThe "mechanisms" that evoke "beauty" in JapanHow Japanese notions of beauty influence society/everyday life in JapanHow Japanese notions of beauty compare (and contrast) with those of other places; what defines "beauty" in Japan/The ability to articulate their knowledge through the cultivation of critical thinking acquired through reading, writing, analysis, and discussions.
